abstract: Supreme Court appears inclined to agree with former Virginia Gov Bob McDonnell that laws under which he was convicted for public corruption grant prosecutors too much power to define routine political favors as corruption.

headline.print_headline: Justices Lean Toward Ex-Governor in Graft Case
headline.main: Justices Lean Toward Bob McDonnell, Ex-Virginia Governor, in Corruption Case

snippet: Several justices said the laws under which Mr. McDonnell had been convicted gave prosecutors too much power to say that political favors amounted to corruption.
lead_paragraph: Several justices said the laws under which Mr. McDonnell had been convicted gave prosecutors too much power to say that political favors amounted to corruption.
